We analyze the effect of applying a Fourier transform \\(F(u(x,t)) = \\hat{u}(\\xi, t)\\) and then solving the equation in the transform domain.

If an intervention in the form of altering diffusivity parameter \\(a\\) at a specific time \\(t_1\\) is applied, will the solution \\(u(x, T)\\) for T > t_1 strictly follow the altered parameter, regardless of initial and boundary conditions?
Explanation: The intervention changes the fundamental dynamics of the equation, and thus the solution depends on the new value of \\(a\\) as well as any residual effects from the initial and boundary conditions. The whole system's response is dependent on a combination of these factors.
